files.description: Defines the required intake fields and their semantics (including claim text and dataset anchor) in a single, importable Python configuration module.
Implements a machine-validated schema (e.g., JSON Schema as a Python dict) for claim card intake, encoding required fields and structural constraints.
Provides hard-fail validation functions that reject claim cards missing required claim text or dataset anchor and emits clear error messages.
Contains example compliant vs non-compliant primary-source verification templates as structured strings/data for reuse in docs and tests.
Updates the intake checklist to codify claim text and dataset anchor as explicitly required fields and mirrors the validator hard-fail rules.
Updates the claim card template to include required claim text and dataset anchor fields and adds an inline compliant vs non-compliant example section for primary-source verification.
Standalone examples showing compliant vs non-compliant inputs focused on primary-source verification, highlighting missing claim text or dataset anchor as hard failures.
Unit tests asserting the validator hard-fails when claim text or dataset anchor is missing and passes when both are present and well-formed.

missionDescription: Codify these as required fields in the intake checklist + validator rules (hard-fail if claim text or dataset anchor is missing) and add an example template showing compliant vs non-compliant inputs for primary-source verification.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
